alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 2:23PM EDT until June 26 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Pennsylvania...and northeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in east central Pennsylvania...Berks and Lehigh. In northeast Pennsylvania... Carbon. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Strausstown, Lenhartsville, Wanamakers, New Tripoli, New Mahoning, Jordan Valley, Schnecksville, and Neffs. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 41. Northeast Extension near mile marker 64. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
